result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah J Davis

records.addlTxt:
Matter set for plea and sentencing.  Atty. Conrardy is in trial and requests a new date.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Isaiah J Davis appeared by video.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Isaiah J Davis.  
Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Hearing held via Zoom.  Status conference held  Atty. Conrardy requests a plea hearing.Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Attorney Fee Trust - Escrow payment plan created 07/29/22 to repay Milwaukee County $50.00 monthly for attorney fees. First payment commencing 09/01/22.

Signed and filed

Order signed and filed in error. Incorrect attorney listed.

Defendant Isaiah J Davis in court.  Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing held via Zoom.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Nicholas Conrardy as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Conrardy accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 9/1/2022 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with N.H.P.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Isaiah J Davis in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Isaiah J Davis in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
